pesticide.PPE: All pesticide handlers must wear long-sleeved shirt and long pants, socks, shoes, chemical-resistant gloves; after dilution and/or when mixing and loading using a closed spray tank transfer system wear shirt, pants, socks, shoes and waterproof gloves; all pesticide handlers must wear a NIOSH approved respirator with any R, P or HE filter or with an organic vapor cartridge or canister with any R, P or HE prefilter when working in non-ventilated spaces; all pesticide handlers must wear protective eyewear when working in non-ventilated spaces.

Safety_Information.general_Info: Harmful if swallowed, inhaled or absorbed through skin. Avoid contact with skin, eyes or clothing. Avoid breathing spray mist. Wash thoroughly with soap and water after handling and before eating, drinking, chewing gum, or using tobacco. Remove contaminated clothing and wash before reuse.
Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing eye. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by the poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing, call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration, preferably by mouth-to-mouth, if possible. Call a poison control center or doctor for further treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Note to Physician - This product is a pyrethroid. If large amounts have been ingested, the stomach and intestine should be evacuated. Treatment is symptomatic and supportive. Digestible fats, oils, or alcohol may increase absorption and so should be avoided.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15 to 20 minutes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
